reviews.review_msg: He isn't a horrible prof and lectures aren't that bad. He requires us to hand in a  journal every week (which require quite a bit of effort), basically a 1000 word essay every week that counts for 1.5% of your grade and he doesn't give any feedback on them which scares me. I liked the class at first but it began to became dreadful after some time.

At a first year level, Kawasaki cannot be any more forgiving. Understanding that most take this course as an elective he structures his course as such: Attend class, do the weekly response questions (prep for the midterm/final), and complete exams which require no critical thinking and you will do absolutely great. Get to know him beyond ASC101 :).
he's aight... just memorize EVERYTHING off the worksheets and you'll be good for the midterm and final
this guy takes an attendence everyday by handing out signing cards and it will reflect on ur mark..... be aware

Course consisted of two tests and marks for attendance. The 3 hour lectures were BORING to say the least. Pretty much spend most of the semester memorizing the hand-out given out and you'll be fine. The book isn't really used besides background reading. A very small portion of the book material is tested.

I dreaded this class every week and couldn't wait to leave 5 mins into the class. He can't communicate information well and is just plain bad at teaching. Can't believe he's the director of ASC!!! I want to drop my ASC Extended Minor because of him. Anyone else can replace him and be 100x better.

Extremely boring class and terrible professor. He gives no breaks and when someone gets up to use the washroom he completely chews them out for it. Completely crazy. Didn't help me at all when I went to his office hours. Don't take his courses!

he's a super super funny prof!! he played sailormoon and doraemon during the break so we could relax! he does have a thick accent but most of the time its not tat hard to understand what he's saying..easy materials..just do the weekly assignments and memorize his handout..i'd say the lowest u can get is a B!

this is an extremely easy class! definitely a GPA booster!! all u have to do is to attend all his lectures and do 10 weekly statements and u get 20% free!!! midterm and final are 40% each!! but all u have to do is to memorize brief dates and u will definitely ace the exam!! everyone take this class!!

Refer to the post below. I literally Laugh Out Loud, as the guy left the exam room. Anywayz, Tsuyoshi gives easy exams, and jokes around in class. Though his lecture are exetremly boring, the notes he gives u are mandatory on the exam so be prepare to memorize it=)

Cool guy! Very funny too! He was giving this guy late to the finals a hard time taking his jacket and all haha...turned out the student was at the wrong exam anyways LOL. Exams were super fair. Attendance very important for the marks. Though accent is a bit heavy, it's nothing to worry about. This prof is very knowledgeable.

Highly reccomend!! Easy course with easy midterm/final and 10 weekly assignments(check upon completion) IF you are looking for a booster, this is the right choice, though his lectures are boring, however, you'll be surprised at easiness of this introductory course =)
Very unorganized, very boring class. Don't ever take this class. You will bound to fall asleep and cannot hear him at all with his heavy accent.BRUTAL CLASS

His lectures are long and boring most of the time without a break in between.  He is unclear about the information most of the time and goes on and on about the same thing.  His voice also puts people to sleep, even the people sitting right up front.
He's a really nice prof. Very helpful when you ask questions during tutorials. Also, it's the easiest class I ever took.  It was my only A+ that I got at SFU.  The course content is fun too.
No Comments

10 weekly statements, 1 mt & 1 final.  Lectures are pretty long, w/no breaks.  Mt is a breeze if u memorize the handout, & u'll get an A for sure if u go over the txt.  The final, however, was harder than i had expected!  Overall, pretty interesting stuff to learn & a funny prof ><!
boring lecture, strong accents, lots of reading but not nesscary, just study for the handout

memorize syllabus; complete assignments; go to lecture is all you need for his asc 101 class.. he gives completion mark for assignments.. exams are easy.. he has heavy accent. lecture is a bit boring. may fall asleep sometimes

readings are hard, but i guess not necessary.  just take good notes, memorize the syllabus and other notes he gives....his accent wasn't hard to understand, at least not to me...it will be an enjoyable class if you are interested in the subject.  give it a shot, not bad

make sure you're interested in the subject/course material.  be prepared to take good notes.  then memorize the notes he's given and your notes.  then skim the textbook.  then ace the class. i onl got a B. ****. but otherwise you should be fine
Extremely funny and entertaining.  Objectives of the course and work load is apparent.

He makes you write a one page paper for the tutorial every week to count for the participation marks. His lectures are boring most of the time, and it will take a while to understand his accent.His exam is ok. His class is not hard, is just annoying with those paper every week.
He is a cool guy~ Seem to know a lot on what he is teaching~ Go off topic durin lecture sometimes~ but gives easy exams~
It was a fun course!  You just need to read his notes and you'll get an A for the course.  Don't even bother reading the text!

super nice prof, super easie final exams, i didnt even bother to open the book and got a B- His accent is somehow a problem but not as think as a typical japanese, trust me !! it's as severe as u think that it is !!! ^_^
esay course, there's no need to read the text, memorize syllabus and u'll do fine...there's no way u can understand him with his heavy japanese accent...
He's a very nice prof
his english is very hard to understand..~
enthusiastic but thick accent makes him difficult to understand.
